page.title: 10BROADWAY SCHOOLS
page.content: The education of children in{Broadway is restricted to Primary School age only. There are three schools. {Broadway First School}opened in 1850 and has 3 teachers and 80 pupils.{St. {Mary's Roman Catholic School}dating from the early 1800's has 3 teachers and fluctuates between 60-80 pupils. {Kirtlands}is a private school founded about forty years ago. It has 8 part time teachers and 50 pupils. Whereas the first two schools have an age range of 4.5 to 11 years, this school has a nursery class and admits pupils from 3.5 to 9 years. All children then have to travel to Middle or High Schools in nearby towns. Computers form part of the curriculum in the State Schools. The{Parent-Teacher {Associations}provide funds for extra equipment. .
